title: Mobile app settings
content:
Service Management provides default settings for the mobile app. To customize the settings, select Administration > Configuration > Application Settings > Mobile App Settings from the main menu.

You can edit the following settings.

Enable the mobile app

By default, the ability to log into SMA using the Enterprise Service Management mobile app is enabled. In the Enable mobile app field, you can disable this by selecting Off. If you disable this feature, the tenant will be unable to use the mobile app, and the suite won't connect to the Google Firebase server, which your system requires for mobile push notifications.

Mobile QR code URL

In the Mobile QR code URL field, you can customize the website URL placed into the mobile app QR code; if this field is left blank, the mobile app uses the default website URL.

Don't append the tenant ID when you manually add the customized website URL in this field.

For more information, see Configure the Enterprise Service Management mobile app.

Enable Microsoft Intune for the mobile app

To provide a seamless sign-in experience, our mobile app uses a WebView-based implementation for authentication. While this works well for most users, it may not be compatible with certain enterprise environments that enforce Microsoft Intune policies.

If your organization uses Microsoft Intune and has configured app protection policies, you may encounter issues signing in through our app. This is due to limitations in WebView-based authentication, which may prevent single sign-on (SSO) or block access entirely depending on your organization's security settings.

For more details, please refer to Microsoft’s documentation on WebView and SSO implications.

When enabled, you can only use the Intune-managed mobile app to log in to this tenant. Otherwise, you can either log in to this tenant from the general mobile app or from the Intune-managed mobile app.

By default, this feature is set to Off.

Before you can configure, assign, protect, or monitor apps, you must add them to Microsoft Intune. 

For Android devices:

    - To use the Intune-managed mobile app in Android devices, please also install Intune Company Portal app as a prerequisite. 

    - Before using the Intune-managed Android mobile app, you need to grant permissions by accessing the following URL (replace the below {tenant-id} with the tenant ID of your Azure AD): 
https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant-id}/adminconsent?client_id=e1e0da1a-ed99-4d5b-a89d-5a962161d271&redirect_uri=msauth://com.microfocus.sma.mobile.app/gYfucgrOlZ3FLWgYctqk1bCxZbo%3D
Open the URL in a browser and log in with your Microsoft Entra administrator account, and click "Accept". 

The instructions and guidelines shown below are based on version 25.3 of the third-party software and are provided "as is" to help guide you through the steps required, and may not be indicative of your third-party applications' interface.
To create an app protection policy on your mobile device, you first need to configure the mobile app in the Intune admin center.

Configure the mobile app in the Intune admin center

To set up the mobile app for both Android and iOS in the Intune admin center, follow these steps:
  1. Go to Microsoft Intune admin center. Click Apps on the left navigation bar and choose Android or iOS/iPadOS as needed. 
    For Android devices, make sure Microsoft Edge is installed as part of your managed applications.
  2. Click All apps, then Add.
  3. Select App type (Android or iOS store app) from the dropdown.
  4. Click the Search the App link.
  5. Type in 'Service Management - Intune' in the search bar.
  6. Click the Service Management - Intune app, then Select.
  7. Add a description, configure the Assignments section if needed, then click Create.

Create an app protection policy for Android

To create an app protection policy for Android, follow these steps:

  1. Choose Android from the Apps Overview page.
  2. Go to Manage apps, select Protection, and click Create to start creating a new protection policy.
  3. Under Basics add a name (required) and a description for the app protection policy you are creating. Click Next.
  4. Under Apps perform the following configurations: 
    • Set Target policy to Selected apps (default).
    • Click on Select custom apps link. Insert the Package ID com.microfocus.sma.mobile.appIntune, and click Add to ensure the package is visible in the Selected Apps section. Then click Select. From the Apps start page, click Next to move to the next step.
  5. Under Data Protection tab, scroll to the Functionality section, then Restrict web content transfer with other apps. Choose Microsoft Edge from the dropdown to force all web content to open with Microsoft Edge browser on your mobile device. Click Next to move to the next step.
  6. Under Assignments tab, assign the users or user groups that will be using the Intune managed applications to the app protection policy.

Create an app protection policy for iOS

To create an app protection policy for iOS, follow these steps:
  1. Choose iOS/iPadOS from the Apps Overview page.
  2. Go to App protection policies and click Create to start creating a new protection policy.
  3. Under Basics, add a name (required) and a description for the app protection policy you are creating. Click Next.
  4. Under Apps perform the following configurations: 
    • Set Target policy to Selected apps (default).
    • Click on Select custom apps link. Insert the Bundle ID com.mf.itsma.mobile.app-intune and click Add to ensure the package is visible in the Selected Apps section. Then click Select. From the Apps start page, click Next to move to the next step.
  5. Click Next and finish the policy configuration in the next few steps.

For more information on the protection policy settings supported by the Intune-managed mobile app, see the Microsoft Android app protection policy settings in Microsoft Intune and the iOS app protection policy settings official documentation.

Pre-define the tenant URL for the Intune-managed mobile app

Intune admin can pre-define the URL of the tenant; thus, the specified tenant URL will be set as the default login URL in the Intune-managed mobile app:

  1. Log in to Microsoft Intune admin center as an Intune admin.
  2. Navigate to Apps > Policy > App configuration policies.
  3. Open the policy that you are going to configure.
  4. Click the Edit option next to Settings.
  5. Expand General configuration settings.
  6. Input the tenant URL for the com.opentext.itsma.PrefilledTenantURL setting. For example: https://mydomain.net:443/saw/ess?TENANTID=123456789

After the configuration, when users log in to the Intune-managed mobile app for the first time, they will be asked to log in to the default tenant directly without manually filling in the tenant URL. 

Allowed Microsoft Intune account domains

Define the list of allowed domains for logging in to the Intune-managed mobile application (comma-separated). If this setting is left blank or specified with an asterisk (*), then no domain check will be performed.

For example, if you set this field as "firstDomain.com, secondDomain.com", then only the users with the accounts of "<username>@firstDomain.com" and "<username>@secondDomain.com" can log in to the Intune-managed mobile application.

Enable Agent Mobile

Select On to enable the Agent interface in the mobile app. Note that the Enable Mobile app option must also be On for this feature to take effect. With this feature enabled, the Agent users can switch to the Agent interface by tapping Switch to Agent Mode in the mobile app.

By default, this feature is set to On.

Enable Debug Settings on mobile

Select On to display the Debug Settings in the mobile app. Select Off to hide the Debug Settings in the mobile app.

Custom applications

Select the custom applications that you want to enable in the mobile app so that users can search for, view, and edit their records in the mobile app.

Allow screen capture on Android

Select On to allow Android users to take screenshots or record the screen when using the mobile app.

By default, this feature is set to Off.
